Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant would face unusual and undeserved or disproportionate hardship if required to apply for permanent residence from outside Canada
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed her visa since 1995, made a false refugee claim in 2005, applied for H&C permanent residence in 2010
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residence
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Overstayed visa, made false refugee claim
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged hardship upon return to Haiti
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship under s. 25(1) IRPA
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of substantial ties in Canada, presence of family support in Haiti
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Application for judicial review under IRPA subsection 72(1)
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly challenged, but insufficient evidence provided
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Details of stay, family connections in Haiti, lack of integration in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Personal hardship, risk upon return, familial and social ties
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Permanent resident status on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section 25(1) IRPA allows discretion for H&C exemptions
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence of personalized hardship or risk
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration officer, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No finding of unusual or disproportionate hardship
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and sought H&C relief due to alleged hardships in Haiti
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed available evidence and found it insufficient
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of documented personal hardship or risk
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: False refugee claim noted as part of history
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Application from within vs. outside Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably concluded no exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No unusual or disproportionate hardship demonstrated
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide sufficient personal evidence of hardship

Crimes.Crime_Name: False refugee claim under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility and H&C application denial
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant faced unusual or disproportionate hardship upon removal
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Type: History of illegal stay and misrepresentation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds due to hardship in Haiti
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Prior false refugee claim and lack of proven hardship
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Administrative immigration proceeding with judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – officer considered all relevant factors
Crimes.Application_Factor: Illegal stay, false claim, family ties in home country
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: No evidence of unusual or disproportionate hardship; false refugee claim
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to prove personal hardship
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant’s past false claim undermined credibility
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for H&C relief based on hardship
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose truth in refugee claim
